articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
My journey into research was anything but straightforward. After finishing school, I initially worked in retail, where I managed a drugstore for a while. It was a valuable experience, but I soon realized that my academic curiosity was far from satisfied. 
Because of the formal regulations surrounding my previous education, I decided to pursue a degree in marketing, which was the closest field related to my professional background. My studies were enriching, but it wasn’t until I spent the final days of my exchange semester at Chile’s breathtaking Torres del Paine National Park that I had a sudden epiphany. I realized that my intellectual hunger was still not satiated, and I needed to follow my long-held interest in psychology. 
This realization led me to the University of Freiburg, where I discovered my true passion for research while working as a student research assistant. Engaging in academic research felt like finding the perfect fit for my inquisitive nature and desire to explore deeper questions. 
When I’m not immersed in research, I love spending time outdoors. You’ll often find me exploring the Alps or relaxing at home on the terrace with my three cats. These moments of tranquility and adventure provide the perfect balance to my academic pursuits.

articles.title: What I'm currently busy with...
articles.contents:
Carbon Dioxide Removal
The project aims to identify affective mechanisms in information search about emerging technologies such as carbon dioxide removal.
We’re testing a new information search paradigm, where people can voluntarily select pieces of information about Carbon Dioxide Removal technologies followed by an affective evaluation of the technology. Subsequently, we want to test whether this affective reactions towards the technology are carried over and are predictive for policy acceptance.
Carbon Tax
The longitudinal project is settled within a larger panel study in three countries: Germany, China and the US.
Climate Anxiety
Currently I’m supervising a master student project that is concerned with media influence on climate anxiety and pro-environmental behavior.
